column4: i did this to share a folder " mount -t vboxsf gnuworld /home/gnuworld" but now all my files on my home directory is gone! i do ls /home/gnuworld everything is gone, i lost it? what can i do?
i did this to share a folder " mount -t vboxsf gnuworld /home/gnuworld" but now all my files on my home directory is gone! i do ls /home/gnuworld everything is gone, i lost it? what can i do?
you didn't lose it, it's just covered by the mount
you regain it by umount /home/gnuworld
aah okay, how can i share /home/bla directory? i did it wrong?
what kind of "share"?
i want to see and edit files on windows7, sharing it by the vbox (ubuntu is on vbox)
you are aware of the possible problems when editing files unter linux and windows?
yes
set "shared folder" in virtualbox ... or put soft/hardlinks to it
i already have 2 folder shared on virtualbox
i maked one folder for copy and past somethings... i did it corretly but when i dont know how to it in /home/bla
why not " mount -t vboxsf gnuworld /home/gnuworld/sharedfolder" ?
cuz i'll have to copy past everything into that folder, all my files are on /home/gnuworld ...
and there are so many files
ln -s /home/gnuworld /sharedfolder/thishomedir    (link to home-dir)
okay, let me try
doesnt work
i cant create ln -s in shared folder while its mounted, and if i do it before mount, when i mount the mount cover the ln -s
"if i do it before mount, when i mount the mount cover the ln -s"  <- don't understund

when i do the "ln s" command while the foulder is mounted(shared) it give me an error, says i cant do it, and when i mount the sharing then i execute the command "ln -s", the ln -s override the sharing.
any ideas?
sorry... no ideas
